column4: hello. I'm going to install ubuntu but I have another 2 partitions from the old windows instalarion. they are ntsc. will I be able to work with them or do I need to backup, change to fat32 and restore my stuff?

hello. I'm going to install ubuntu but I have another 2 partitions from the old windows instalarion. they are ntsc. will I be able to work with them or do I need to backup, change to fat32 and restore my stuff?
assuming you mean ntfs, you can read them, but writing isn't really safe
if you won't be using windows, just move your stuff to ext3
